finance-adults-1.title: Income vs Expense Reality
finance-adults-1.description: ₹18,000 income versus ₹20,000 expenses—what does this gap teach you?

finance-adults-2.title: What Is Financial Literacy?
finance-adults-2.description: Financial literacy means making smart choices when earning, saving, spending, or borrowing.

finance-adults-3.title: Needs vs Wants - Daily Choices
finance-adults-3.description: Distinguish between needs and wants to protect your monthly budget.

finance-adults-4.title: Fixed vs Variable Expenses
finance-adults-4.description: Learn to distinguish between fixed and variable expenses to plan your budget safely.

finance-adults-5.title: Salary Day Decision
finance-adults-5.description: Learn to plan your salary allocation to reduce the need for borrowing later.

finance-adults-6.title: Spending Adjustment Test
finance-adults-6.description: Learn to adjust spending before resorting to borrowing when facing small financial gaps.

finance-adults-7.title: Tracking Money Habits
finance-adults-7.description: Learn to track your daily spending to reveal hidden money leaks.

finance-adults-8.title: Savings vs Borrowing
finance-adults-8.description: Learn to use savings instead of borrowing for emergencies to reduce dependence on credit.

finance-adults-9.title: Monthly Budget Balance
finance-adults-9.description: Learn to balance expenses within fixed income to prevent debt cycles.

finance-adults-10.title: Financial Discipline Checkpoint
finance-adults-10.description: Complete 7 correct financial decisions to demonstrate basic money discipline.

finance-adults-11.title: Why a Bank Account Matters
finance-adults-11.description: Learn about the importance of bank accounts for securing your income and accessing formal financial services.

finance-adults-12.title: KYC Basics
finance-adults-12.description: Learn about Know Your Customer (KYC) procedures and why banks require identity verification.

finance-adults-13.title: Formal vs Informal Finance
finance-adults-13.description: Learn about the differences between formal and informal financial services and why formal finance is safer.

finance-adults-14.title: Digital Payments Safety
finance-adults-14.description: Learn about safe practices when using digital payment methods like UPI and protecting your financial information.

finance-adults-15.title: Multiple Accounts Confusion
finance-adults-15.description: Learn about the importance of simplifying your banking by managing fewer accounts effectively.

finance-adults-16.title: Digital Wallet vs Bank Account
finance-adults-16.description: Learn about the differences between digital wallets and bank accounts for various financial needs.

finance-adults-17.title: Safe Use of Banking Apps
finance-adults-17.description: Learn about the safe practices for using banking apps and protecting your financial information.

finance-adults-18.title: Cash vs Digital Records
finance-adults-18.description: Learn about the benefits of digital transactions and how records help with budgeting and credit eligibility.

finance-adults-19.title: Trusting the System
finance-adults-19.description: Learn about the safety and regulation of banking systems and why regulated institutions are safer than informal storage.

finance-adults-20.title: Banking Readiness Checkpoint
finance-adults-20.description: Complete 7 correct banking and digital finance decisions to demonstrate readiness for credit and loans.

finance-adults-21.title: What Is Credit?
finance-adults-21.description: Learn the fundamental concept of credit and understand when credit is helpful versus harmful.

finance-adults-22.title: When Credit Is Useful
finance-adults-22.description: Learn when borrowing is reasonable and how to evaluate credit decisions that support financial stability.

finance-adults-23.title: Types of Loans
finance-adults-23.description: Learn to distinguish between formal and informal lending options and understand regulated pricing benefits.

finance-adults-24.title: Personal vs Business Loan
finance-adults-24.description: Learn to distinguish between personal and business loans and understand proper financing selection for business needs.

finance-adults-25.title: Credit Eligibility Basics
finance-adults-25.description: Learn the fundamental factors that improve loan eligibility and how financial discipline opens access to formal credit.

finance-adults-26.title: Loan Rejection Reality
finance-adults-26.description: Why do banks reject applications? Understand loan rejection reasons and turn setbacks into financial growth opportunities.

finance-adults-27.title: Loan Amount Decision
finance-adults-27.description: You qualify for ₹1,00,000 but only need ₹40,000. Learn to borrow only what you can repay comfortably.

finance-adults-28.title: Credit Is Not Income
finance-adults-28.description: Credit should be treated as temporary support to be repaid, not extra income. Learn to avoid debt traps.

finance-adults-29.title: Multiple Loans Risk
finance-adults-29.description: Taking many loans at once leads to higher repayment stress. Learn to avoid loan stacking and default risk.

finance-adults-30.title: Credit for Emergencies
finance-adults-30.description: Is credit the first solution for emergencies? Learn why emergency funds reduce harmful borrowing.

finance-adults-31.title: Trusting Loan Offers
finance-adults-31.description: A lender promises 'guaranteed approval.' Learn why these offers often hide risks and require verification.

finance-adults-32.title: Credit Understanding Checkpoint
finance-adults-32.description: Make 8 correct credit-related decisions. You now understand how credit works and when it should be used.

finance-adults-33.title: What Is Interest?
finance-adults-33.description: Interest is the cost of borrowing money. Learn what you pay for using someone else's money.

finance-adults-34.title: Higher Loan, Higher Cost
finance-adults-34.description: If you borrow more money, total interest usually increases. Learn how bigger loans mean higher repayment burden.

finance-adults-35.title: EMI Meaning
finance-adults-35.description: EMI stands for Equated Monthly Instalment. Learn how EMIs divide loan repayment into monthly amounts.

finance-adults-36.title: EMI vs Income
finance-adults-36.description: Which EMI is safer? Learn why EMIs that fit comfortably within income reduce stress and increase financial flexibility.

finance-adults-37.title: Short Tenure vs Long Tenure
finance-adults-37.description: Longer loan tenure usually means higher total interest. Learn why smaller EMIs over long periods cost more overall.

finance-adults-38.title: Missed EMI Consequence
finance-adults-38.description: What happens if you miss EMIs? Learn why penalties and credit damage affect future borrowing ability.

finance-adults-39.title: Prepayment Awareness
finance-adults-39.description: Paying extra towards loan early can reduce interest burden. Learn why early repayment saves money when allowed.

finance-adults-40.title: Fixed vs Variable Interest
finance-adults-40.description: Which loan has predictable EMIs? Learn why fixed interest loans help with budgeting and financial planning.

finance-adults-41.title: Hidden Charges
finance-adults-41.description: Loan cost includes processing fees and charges beyond EMIs. Learn why you should always check the full cost, not just EMI.

finance-adults-42.title: EMI Discipline
finance-adults-42.description: Best habit for EMI safety is paying on or before due date every month. Learn why timely payment protects credit history.

finance-adults-43.title: Loan Restructuring Awareness
finance-adults-43.description: If income drops suddenly, talk to lender early for options. Learn why early communication prevents defaults.

finance-adults-44.title: Repayment Readiness Checkpoint
finance-adults-44.description: Make 5 correct decisions related to interest and repayment. Learn how loan costs and repayments work comprehensively.

finance-adults-45.title: Borrowing as Last Option
finance-adults-45.description: You face a temporary cash gap. Learn why borrowing should be the last step, not the first.

finance-adults-46.title: Over-Borrowing Risk
finance-adults-46.description: Taking a loan larger than needed usually leads to higher repayment stress. Learn why bigger loans increase risk without extra benefit.

finance-adults-47.title: Loan Stacking Danger
finance-adults-47.description: Taking multiple loans at the same time causes confusing repayments and defaults. Learn why loan stacking is a common debt trap.

finance-adults-48.title: Borrowing for Wants
finance-adults-48.description: Is it wise to borrow for luxury spending? Learn why borrowing for wants leads to long-term stress and unnecessary debt.

finance-adults-49.title: Income Stability Check
finance-adults-49.description: When is borrowing safer? Learn why stable and predictable income supports disciplined repayment and makes borrowing much safer.

finance-adults-50.title: Peer Pressure Loans
finance-adults-50.description: Friends encourage you to take a loan. Learn why borrowing decisions must be personal and realistic, not influenced by peer pressure.

finance-adults-51.title: Emergency vs Lifestyle Loans
finance-adults-51.description: Scenario: Which borrowing is more justified? (A) Emergency medical need or (B) Lifestyle upgrade. Outcome: Emergencies justify credit more than comfort.

finance-adults-52.title: Repayment Capacity Test
finance-adults-52.description: Scenario: Which EMI is risky? (A) EMI below 20–30% of income or (B) EMI above 50% of income. Outcome: High EMIs reduce financial safety.

finance-adults-53.title: Borrowing Frequency
finance-adults-53.description: Scenario: Frequent borrowing usually signals: (A) Smart money use or (B) Poor financial planning. Outcome: Frequent loans indicate deeper issues.

finance-adults-54.title: Loan Purpose Clarity
finance-adults-54.description: Scenario: Why should loan purpose be clear? (A) For lender only or (B) To ensure money is used wisely. Outcome: Clear purpose improves repayment success.

finance-adults-55.title: Ignoring Warning Signs
finance-adults-55.description: Scenario: Which is a warning sign? (A) Difficulty paying EMIs or (B) Comfortable repayment (reverse logic). Outcome: Early warning signs must be addressed quickly.

finance-adults-56.title: Emotional Borrowing
finance-adults-56.description: Scenario: Borrowing during emotional stress often leads to: (A) Good decisions or (B) Regret later. Outcome: Calm decisions protect financial health.

finance-adults-57.title: Saying No to Credit
finance-adults-57.description: Scenario: Is it okay to reject a loan offer? (A) No or (B) Yes, if it's unnecessary or risky. Outcome: Saying no is a financial strength.

finance-adults-58.title: Responsible Borrowing Checkpoint
finance-adults-58.description: Task: Avoid risky borrowing in 9 scenarios. Outcome Message: You can now recognise and avoid harmful borrowing patterns.

finance-adults-59.title: Instant Loan Temptation
finance-adults-59.description: Scenario: An app offers 'Instant loan in 5 minutes.' What should you do first? (A) Accept immediately or (B) Check legitimacy and terms. Outcome: Speed often hides risk in digital lending.

finance-adults-60.title: App Permission Check
finance-adults-60.description: Scenario: A loan app asks access to contacts and photos. Is this safe? (A) Yes or (B) No, it's a red flag. Outcome: Excess permissions enable harassment and misuse.

finance-adults-61.title: Official vs Fake Apps
finance-adults-61.description: Scenario: How do you identify a safer app? (A) Random download link or (B) Official app store + verified developer. Outcome: Verified sources reduce fraud risk.

finance-adults-62.title: Guaranteed Approval Claim
finance-adults-62.description: Scenario: An app promises 'Guaranteed approval, no checks.' What does this mean? (A) Helpful service or (B) High-risk lending trap. Outcome: No-check loans often lead to abuse.

finance-adults-63.title: Data Privacy Awareness
finance-adults-63.description: Scenario: Why is data privacy important in loan apps? (A) It's not important or (B) Personal data can be misused. Outcome: Data misuse causes long-term harm.

finance-adults-64.title: Harassment Warning
finance-adults-64.description: Scenario: What should you do if a lender threatens or harasses you? (A) Stay silent or (B) Seek help and report. Outcome: Harassment is illegal and must be addressed.

finance-adults-65.title: Reading Terms Carefully
finance-adults-65.description: Scenario: Before accepting a digital loan, what must you read? (A) Only the loan amount or (B) Interest, fees, and repayment terms. Outcome: Hidden terms cause repayment shock.

finance-adults-66.title: Loan App Reviews
finance-adults-66.description: Scenario: Why should you check reviews? (A) For entertainment or (B) To identify user complaints and risks. Outcome: Past user experiences reveal hidden problems.

finance-adults-67.title: Multiple App Loans
finance-adults-67.description: Scenario: Taking loans from many apps leads to: (A) Flexibility or (B) Severe repayment stress. Outcome: App-based loan stacking is dangerous.

finance-adults-68.title: Contact Sharing Risk
finance-adults-68.description: Scenario: Why is sharing contacts risky? (A) It helps repayment or (B) It enables harassment of friends/family. Outcome: Protecting contacts protects dignity.

finance-adults-69.title: Safe Exit Decision
finance-adults-69.description: Scenario: You realise a loan app is unsafe. What should you do? (A) Continue using it or (B) Stop, repay safely, and uninstall. Outcome: Early exit reduces damage.

finance-adults-70.title: Digital Safety Checkpoint
finance-adults-70.description: Task: Identify and avoid unsafe digital lending practices in 8 scenarios. Outcome Message: You can now safely navigate digital loan offers.

finance-adults-71.title: Personal vs Business Money
finance-adults-71.description: Scenario: You run a small shop. Which is safer? (A) Using one account for everything or (B) Separating personal and business money. Outcome: Separation improves clarity and control.

finance-adults-72.title: Cash Flow vs Profit
finance-adults-72.description: Scenario: Your business shows profit, but no cash is available. Why? (A) Profit equals cash or (B) Cash flow timing matters. Outcome: Cash flow problems cause business stress even with profit.

finance-adults-73.title: Inventory Purchase Decision
finance-adults-73.description: Scenario: You want to buy extra stock. What should you check first? (A) Supplier pressure or (B) Expected sales and cash availability. Outcome: Inventory should match demand, not hope.

finance-adults-74.title: Credit for Business Growth
finance-adults-74.description: Scenario: When is business borrowing safer? (A) To cover losses or (B) To support planned growth with cash flow. Outcome: Credit should support growth, not hide problems.

finance-adults-75.title: Daily Expense Tracking
finance-adults-75.description: Scenario: What habit improves business control? (A) Memory-based tracking or (B) Daily expense recording. Outcome: Records reveal leaks and trends.

finance-adults-76.title: Seasonal Income Planning
finance-adults-76.description: Scenario: Your income is seasonal. What helps? (A) Spending freely in peak months or (B) Saving for low-income periods. Outcome: Season planning prevents emergency borrowing.

finance-adults-77.title: Supplier Credit Trap
finance-adults-77.description: Scenario: Supplier offers unlimited credit. What's the risk? (A) None or (B) Hidden pressure and repayment stress. Outcome: Supplier credit can quietly become debt.

finance-adults-78.title: Mixing Business Loans
finance-adults-78.description: Scenario: Using a personal loan for business causes: (A) No issue or (B) Confusion and repayment problems. Outcome: Loan purpose mismatch increases risk.

finance-adults-79.title: Emergency Business Expenses
finance-adults-79.description: Scenario: A machine breaks down. What's safer first? (A) Immediate high-interest loan or (B) Savings or planned repair fund. Outcome: Preparedness reduces costly borrowing.

finance-adults-80.title: Pricing Discipline
finance-adults-80.description: Scenario: Selling below cost leads to: (A) Growth or (B) Long-term losses. Outcome: Correct pricing sustains business health.

finance-adults-81.title: Credit Sales Risk
finance-adults-81.description: Scenario: Giving goods on credit without records causes: (A) Customer loyalty or (B) Cash flow problems. Outcome: Unrecorded credit sales damage liquidity.

finance-adults-82.title: Business Finance Checkpoint
finance-adults-82.description: Task: Make 8 safe financial decisions for a small business. Outcome Message: You can now manage business money with discipline and foresight.

finance-adults-83.title: What Is a Financial Shock?
finance-adults-83.description: Scenario: Which is a financial shock? (A) Planned monthly rent or (B) Sudden medical expense. Outcome: Financial shocks are unexpected and disruptive.

finance-adults-84.title: First Response to Emergency
finance-adults-84.description: Scenario: You face an unexpected expense. What should you check first? (A) Loan apps or (B) Savings or emergency fund. Outcome: Savings reduce panic borrowing.

finance-adults-85.title: Emergency Fund Purpose
finance-adults-85.description: Scenario: Emergency funds are meant for: (A) Daily spending or (B) Unexpected critical needs. Outcome: Using emergency funds wisely protects stability.

finance-adults-86.title: How Much Emergency Fund?
finance-adults-86.description: Scenario: A safe emergency fund usually covers: (A) 1–2 days of expenses or (B) 3–6 months of basic expenses. Outcome: Adequate reserves reduce long-term stress.

finance-adults-87.title: Health Emergency Planning
finance-adults-87.description: Scenario: Which reduces medical borrowing risk? (A) Ignoring health planning or (B) Basic insurance or savings. Outcome: Health planning prevents high-interest debt.

finance-adults-88.title: Income Loss Scenario
finance-adults-88.description: Scenario: You lose income temporarily. What helps most? (A) Immediate borrowing or (B) Reduced expenses + emergency fund. Outcome: Expense control buys time without debt.

finance-adults-89.title: Multiple Emergencies
finance-adults-89.description: Scenario: Facing repeated emergencies usually means: (A) Bad luck only or (B) Lack of preparedness. Outcome: Preparedness reduces repeated shocks.

finance-adults-90.title: Avoiding Panic Decisions
finance-adults-90.description: Scenario: Panic borrowing often leads to: (A) Quick relief or (B) Long-term debt stress. Outcome: Calm decisions protect future stability.

finance-adults-91.title: Emergency Credit Use
finance-adults-91.description: Scenario: When is using credit acceptable? (A) When no other option exists and repayment is planned or (B) As first response. Outcome: Planned credit is safer than panic credit.

finance-adults-92.title: Emergency Preparedness Checkpoint
finance-adults-92.description: Task: Handle 7 emergency scenarios safely. Outcome: You are now prepared to face financial shocks without panic borrowing.

finance-adults-93.title: Short-Term vs Long-Term Thinking
finance-adults-93.description: Scenario: Which choice supports long-term stability? (A) Solving only today's problem or (B) Planning for future needs. Outcome: Long-term thinking reduces repeated financial stress.

finance-adults-94.title: Credit History Awareness
finance-adults-94.description: Scenario: Why does repayment history matter? (A) It doesn't matter or (B) It affects future credit access. Outcome: Good repayment behaviour builds trust with lenders.

finance-adults-95.title: Formal Finance Trust
finance-adults-95.description: Scenario: Why should people use formal financial systems? (A) They are unregulated or (B) They offer protection and accountability. Outcome: Formal systems reduce exploitation.

finance-adults-96.title: Gradual Financial Inclusion
finance-adults-96.description: Scenario: What is a safer path to financial inclusion? (A) Taking large loans immediately or (B) Gradual use of banking and small credit. Outcome: Gradual inclusion reduces mistakes.

finance-adults-97.title: Behaviour Over Income
finance-adults-97.description: Scenario: What matters more for financial health? (A) Income alone or (B) Financial behaviour and discipline. Outcome: Good habits protect income at all levels.

finance-adults-98.title: Learning from Past Mistakes
finance-adults-98.description: Scenario: You made a poor financial decision earlier. What helps now? (A) Ignoring it or (B) Learning and adjusting behaviour. Outcome: Reflection prevents repeating mistakes.

finance-adults-99.title: Financial Confidence
finance-adults-99.description: Scenario: Financial confidence comes from: (A) Taking risks blindly or (B) Understanding choices and consequences. Outcome: Knowledge builds confidence, not risk.

finance-adults-100.title: Financial Inclusion Mastery Checkpoint
finance-adults-100.description: Task: Demonstrate safe financial behaviour across multiple scenarios. Outcome: You are ready to participate confidently and responsibly in the formal financial system.
